medical_history.chief_complaint: Abnormal growth in two children with altered copy number of the IGF1R gene.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Case 1: The girl exhibited intrauterine growth retardation and failure to thrive from 1 month old, requiring assessment and management of recurrent hypoglycemia. After cardiac surgeries at 9 months, her poor growth continued, remaining under the 3rd percentile by 10 years old. Case 2: The boy was large for gestational age at birth, showed rapid growth in early postnatal periods, and exhibited stable growth velocity, maintaining height above the 99.6th percentile.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Case 1: Intrauterine growth retardation, postnatal growth failure, recurrent hypoglycemia, atrial septal defect, ventricular septal defect. Case 2: Operated for bilateral inguinal hernias.
medical_history.family_history: Father: 187.5 cm, Mother: 182.5 cm (Case 2). Family history of healthy and normally grown siblings in both cases.
